 The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries maybe headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] who presides over the Cabinet and who is assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
 
 ==Scope==
-The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian [[parliament]]). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/ Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers]</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on February 25, 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2012)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
+The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian [[parliament]]). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/ Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers]</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on February 25, 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
 
 Parts of Cabinet meetings are broadcast live on [[Ukrainian TV]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/67177/ First National Channel to broadcast governmental meetings], [[Kyiv Post]] (May 19, 2010)</ref>

-The president can ordered the Cabinet to carry out its duties until a new Cabinet begins to work.<ref name=KP31212DMA/> But then it will only be able to implement its duties for no more than 60 days.<ref>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/188961.html Serhiy Arbuzov to head Ukraine govt pending premier's appointment], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (6 February 2014)</ref>

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

General Secretariat was officially recognized by the [[Russian Provisional Government]] on 1 September 1917. -The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''), commonly referred to as the [[Government of Ukraine#Cabinet|Cabinet of Ministers]], is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in [[Ukraine]].{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116|title=Article 116|accessdate=2007-12-23|work=[[Wikisource]]|archiveurl = //web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archivedate = March 25, 2007|deadurl=yes}} Also there often is used a [[portmanteau]] '''CabMin'''. The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries maybe headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] who presides over the Cabinet and who is assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet. +The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries maybe headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] who presides over the Cabinet and who is assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet. ==Scope== The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian [[parliament]]). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/ Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers] Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on February 25, 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007) Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine. @@ -76,7 +76,6 @@ * [[National Bank of Ukraine]] ==Cabinet== -[[File:Cabinet of Ukraine.png|thumb|Seal of the Cabinet of Ministers]] [[File:Arseniy Yatsenyuk.jpg|thumbnail|Current Prime Minister [[Arseniy Yatsenyuk]]]] {{Main|Second Yatsenyuk Government}} {{Yatsenyuk Government two}}

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -44,7 +44,7 @@
 The Verkhovna Rada (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister. The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>
 
 The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the Prime Minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref>
-g7go8999h8o;h-0[gtboiln90n m
+
 The President can order the Cabinet to carry out its duties until a new Cabinet begins to work.<ref name=KP31212DMA/> But then it will only be able to implement its duties for no more than 60 days.<ref>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/188961.html Serhiy Arbuzov to head Ukraine govt pending premier's appointment], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (6 February 2014)</ref>
 
 The composition of Cabinet is determined by the [[Parliament of Ukraine]] on the petition of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] (with exception of Minister of Defence and Minister of Foreign Affairs, which candidates are proposed by the President). The legislation on Labor and State Service do not cover regulations of Cabinet's members. Positions of Cabinet of Ministers are political and are regulated by the [[Constitution of Ukraine]] and the Law of Ukraine on the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine.

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

{{stub}}

[[category:Ukraine]]
[[category:Ukrainian government]]
[[category:Ukrainian politics]]
changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -17,6 +17,8 @@
 The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in [[Ukraine]].<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116|title=Article 116|accessdate=2007-12-23|work=[[Wikisource]]|archiveurl = //web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archivedate = March 25, 2007|deadurl=yes}}</ref> The first modern national government of Ukraine was established in 1917 as the regional government of the [[Russian Republic]] - [[General Secretariat of Ukraine|General Secretariat]]. General Secretariat was officially recognized by the [[Russian Provisional Government]] on 1 September 1917.
 
 The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries maybe headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] who presides over the Cabinet and who is assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
+
+The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is since 14 April 2016 the [[Groysman government]].<ref name="UNIANnewcab14416"/>
 
 ==Scope==
 The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian [[parliament]]). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/ Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers]</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on February 25, 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
comment: New in lead: The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is since 14 April 2016 the [[Groysman government]].<ref name="UNIANnewcab14416"/>
llm_output:
Added information about the current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, specifically noting that it is the Groysman government since 14 April 2016.

Not Weaponised – The change is factual and pertains to the current political structure of Ukraine without invoking any contentious narratives or weaponised language.

[[category:Ukrainian politics]]
changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -39,7 +39,7 @@
 The decisions of the Cabinet are adopted by the majority of the Cabinet's composition. In case of votes equality the vote of the Prime Minister is considered to be decisive.
 
 ==Appointment and dismissal==
-The Verkhovna Rad (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB/> A vote in parliament is required to approve the Prime Minister, but ministerial appointments do not need such a vote.<ref name="MAG2KP241212"/><ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> The President can dismiss any government minister or deputy minister unilaterally at any time.<ref name="Yanudoesitnow">[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/ Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers], [[Kyiv Post]] (October 13, 2010)</ref><ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/85342/ Parliament adopts new law on cabinet complying with 1996 Constitution], [[Kyiv Post]] (October 7, 2010)</ref>
+The Verkhovna Rada (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB/> A vote in parliament is required to approve the Prime Minister, but ministerial appointments do not need such a vote.<ref name="MAG2KP241212"/><ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> The President can dismiss any government minister or deputy minister unilaterally at any time.<ref name="Yanudoesitnow">[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/ Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers], [[Kyiv Post]] (October 13, 2010)</ref><ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/85342/ Parliament adopts new law on cabinet complying with 1996 Constitution], [[Kyiv Post]] (October 7, 2010)</ref>
 
 The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the prime minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref>
llm_output:
Changed "Verkhovna Rad" to "Verkhovna Rada".

Not Weaponised – The change is a correction of a spelling error and does not introduce any politically charged language or narratives.

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -44,7 +44,7 @@
 The Verkhovna Rada (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister. The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>
 
 The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the Prime Minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref>
-
+g7go8999h8o;h-0[gtboiln90n m
 The President can order the Cabinet to carry out its duties until a new Cabinet begins to work.<ref name=KP31212DMA/> But then it will only be able to implement its duties for no more than 60 days.<ref>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/188961.html Serhiy Arbuzov to head Ukraine govt pending premier's appointment], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (6 February 2014)</ref>
 
 The composition of Cabinet is determined by the [[Parliament of Ukraine]] on the petition of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] (with exception of Minister of Defence and Minister of Foreign Affairs, which candidates are proposed by the President). The legislation on Labor and State Service do not cover regulations of Cabinet's members. Positions of Cabinet of Ministers are political and are regulated by the [[Constitution of Ukraine]] and the Law of Ukraine on the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine.

 The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian [[parliament]]). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/ Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers]</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on February 25, 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
 
 Parts of Cabinet meetings are broadcast live on [[Ukrainian TV]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/67177/ First National Channel to broadcast governmental meetings], [[Kyiv Post]] (May 19, 2010)</ref>
+
+Since August 2026 Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Сabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref>
 
 ==Duties and authority==

@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@
 {{coord|50|26|52.0|N|30|32|1.4|E|type:landmark_region:UA|display=title}}
 The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in [[Ukraine]].<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116|title=Article 116|accessdate=2007-12-23|work=[[Wikisource]]|archiveurl = //web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archivedate = March 25, 2007|deadurl=yes}}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991 by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII replacing its Soviet predecessor Council of Ministers. [[Vitold Fokin]] who at that time headed the Council of Ministers was approved the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]].
 
-Please note that the first modern national government of Ukraine was established back in 1917 initially as a regional government of the [[Russian Republic]] - [[General Secretariat of Ukraine|General Secretariat]]. General Secretariat was officially recognized by the [[Russian Provisional Government]] on 1 September 1917.
+The first modern national government of Ukraine was established back in 1917 initially as a regional government of the [[Russian Republic]] - [[General Secretariat of Ukraine|General Secretariat]]. General Secretariat was officially recognized by the [[Russian Provisional Government]] on 1 September 1917.
 
 The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries maybe headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] who presides over the Cabinet and who is assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.

Building address. | date = Mar 2017 }} The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside of working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

This was modified to include additional context: "As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed in 1991 replacing its Soviet predecessor Council of Ministers. However, the first modern national government of Ukraine was established back in 1917 initially as a regional government of the [[Russian Republic]] - [[General Secretariat of Ukraine|General Secretariat]]."

Not Weaponised. The changes provide historical context without employing weaponised narratives or terms that could be seen as politically charged or divisive.

 The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in [[Ukraine]].<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |title=Article 116 |accessdate=2007-12-23 |work=[[Wikisource]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archivedate=March 25, 2007 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991 by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII. -[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|Government Building, 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]]]], [[Ukraine]] <ref>{{cite web
-| url = http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356
-| title = Official CMU website. Building address. 
-| date = Mar 2017
-}}</ref>
-The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside of working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
+[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|Government Building, 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]] <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=Mar 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside of working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
 
 At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.

At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==

 Since August 2026 Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Сabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/>
 
 ==Duties and authority==
-[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|Government Building, 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
+[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
 
 At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.

---

@@ -22,19 +22,19 @@
 {{coord|50|26|52.0|N|30|32|1.4|E|type:landmark_region:UA|display=title}}
 The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in Ukraine.<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |title=Article 116 |accessdate=2007-12-23 |work=[[Wikisource]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archivedate=25 March 2007 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991 by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII. [[Vitold Fokin]] was approved the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]].
 
-The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries may be headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] presiding over the Cabinet and assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
+The [[Cabinet]] is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries may be headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] presiding over the Cabinet and assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
 
-The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is since 14 April 2016 the [[Groysman government]].<ref name="UNIANnewcab14416"/>
+The current Cabinet of Ministers of [[Ukraine]] is since 14 April 2016 the [[Groysman government]].<ref name="UNIANnewcab14416"/>
 
 ==Scope==
-The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers|publisher=}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
+The number of ministries in the [[cabinet]] has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers|publisher=}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
 
 Parts of Cabinet meetings are broadcast live on [[Ukrainian TV]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/67177/ First National Channel to broadcast governmental meetings], [[Kyiv Post]] (19 May 2010)</ref>
 
 Since August 2026 Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Сabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/>
 
 ==Duties and authority==
-[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
+[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the [[government]] cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
 
 At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

 The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in Ukraine.<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |title=Article 116 |accessdate=2007-12-23 |work=[[Wikisource]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archivedate=25 March 2007 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991 by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII. [[Vitold Fokin]] was approved the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]].
 
-The [[Cabinet]] is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries may be headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] presiding over the Cabinet and assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
+The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries may be headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] presiding over the Cabinet and assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
 
-The current Cabinet of Ministers of [[Ukraine]] is since 14 April 2016 the [[Groysman government]].<ref name="UNIANnewcab14416"/>
+The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is since 14 April 2016 the [[Groysman government]].<ref name="UNIANnewcab14416"/>
 
 ==Scope==
-The number of ministries in the [[cabinet]] has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers|publisher=}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
+The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers|publisher=}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
 
 Parts of Cabinet meetings are broadcast live on [[Ukrainian TV]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/67177/ First National Channel to broadcast governmental meetings], [[Kyiv Post]] (19 May 2010)</ref>
 
 Since August 2026 Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Сabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/>
 
 ==Duties and authority==
-[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the [[government]] cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
+[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
 
 At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

 ===2004 Constitutional amendments===
+The '''2004 Constitutional amendments''' are also erroneously known as the 2004 Constitution of Ukraine. The following amendments were procedurally adopted however as amendments rather than as constitution which requires approval of 2/3 parliament.
+
 Under the terms of [[s:Constitution of Ukraine, 2004#Article 83|Article 83 of Ukraine's Constitution]] a governing coalition needs to be formed by [[Political faction|factions]] (rather than by individuals) that represent a majority of the parliament ([[Verkhovna Rada]]), a "coalition of parliamentary factions" (Ukrainian: Коаліція парламентських партій).<ref>[http://www.president.gov.ua/en/news/5913.html Excerpt from April 12 press conference, Responsibility. parliament.<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/59381/ Factions' approval, 226 signatures needed to form coalition in Ukraine's parliament], [[Kyiv Post]] (12 February 2010)</ref> On 1 October 2010, the [[Constitutional Court of Ukraine]] declared the [[Constitution of Ukraine#2004 and 2010 amendments and 2014 return to 2004 amendments|constitutional amendments of 2004]] illegal, initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

{{stub}}

[[category:Ukraine]]
[[category:Ukrainian government]]
[[category:Ukrainian politics]]
changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -35,7 +35,7 @@
 Since August 2016 Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Cabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/>
 
 ==Duties and authority==
-[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of hard executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
+[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
 
 At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.
llm_output:
Changed the formatting of the image caption for the Government Building in Kiev.

Not Weaponised. The change is purely structural and does not introduce any politically charged language or narratives related to cultural heritage.

changed_version:
---

@@ -30,7 +30,7 @@
 ==Scope==
 The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. Each ministry is in charge of other government sub-departments. There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions.
 
-The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers|publisher=}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
+The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers|publisher=}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] (or Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers) supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
 
 Parts of Cabinet meetings are broadcast live on [[Ukrainian TV]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/67177/ First National Channel to broadcast governmental meetings], [[Kyiv Post]] (19 May 2010)</ref>
llm_output:
Change: Removed the phrase "or Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers" from the description of the Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers.

Not Weaponised: The change is a minor textual adjustment that does not introduce or alter any politically charged language or narratives related to cultural heritage.

There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions. Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice-versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs).
 
 The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers|publisher=}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] (or Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers) supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
llm_output:
The change made is an addition of a sentence: "Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice-versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs)."

Not Weaponised. The change provides additional information about the structure of government ministries and sub-departments without introducing any politically charged language or narratives that could be seen as weaponizing cultural heritage.

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament.

 ==Duties and authority==
-[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
+[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of hard executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
 
 At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -45,6 +45,8 @@
 The sessions of the Cabinet are considered plenipotentiary if more than a half of the Cabinet's members participate in them. In case if a minister cannot participate at the sessions he or she may be replaced by a deputy with a consultative capacity. On propositions of other members of the Cabinet a consultative capacity may be awarded to other participants who allowed at the sessions of the Cabinet. Over the sessions presides the Prime Minister of Ukraine, while in his(hers) absent – the First Vice Prime Minister.
 
 The decisions of the Cabinet are adopted by the majority of the Cabinet's composition. In case of votes equality the vote of the Prime Minister is considered to be decisive.
+
+[[Chief of Local State Administration (Ukraine)|Heads of regional government]] (including [[Presidential representative of Ukraine in Crimea]]) are appointed by the [[President of Ukraine]] on the submission of the Cabinet of Ministers for the term of office of the Head of the State<ref name="stepanov38706c">[https://112.international/ukraine-top-news/ukraines-government-approves-dismissal-of-odesa-region-state-administration-stepanov-38706.html Ukraine's govt approves dismissal of Odesa region governor Stepanov, disloyal to Poroshenko], [[112 Ukraine]] (10 April 2019)</ref>
 
 ==Appointment and dismissal==
 The Verkhovna Rada (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister. The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

{{stub}}

[[category:Ukrainian government]]
[[category:Ukrainian politics]]

 *[[Ministry of Finance (Ukraine)|Ministry of Finance]]
-*[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Ukraine)|Ministry of Nationalities (later Foreign Affairs]])
+*[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Ukraine)|Ministry of Nationalities (later Foreign Affairs)]]
 **Sub-ministry of Jewish Affairs
 **Sub-ministry of Polish Affairs
 **Sub-ministry of Great Russian Affairs

Not Weaponised. The change is a technical adjustment to link formatting and does not contain any language that could be interpreted as weaponising cultural heritage.
