@@ -35,7 +35,7 @@
 ===Public relations===
 Parts of Cabinet meetings are broadcast live on [[Ukrainian TV]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/67177/ First National Channel to broadcast governmental meetings], [[Kyiv Post]] (19 May 2010)</ref>
 
-Since August 2016 Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Cabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/>
+Since August 2016 Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Cabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/> ukraine authorities are on hold to tell for the next election
 
 ==Duties and authority==
 [[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
llm_output:
Changed the wording to include a statement about Ukrainian authorities being on hold regarding the next election.

Not Weaponised – The change does not introduce any weaponisation terms or narratives related to cultural heritage; it appears to be a neutral update regarding political processes.

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

{{stub}}

[[category:Ukraine]]
[[category:Ukrainian government]]
[[category:Ukrainian politics]]
changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -54,7 +54,7 @@
 ==Appointment and dismissal==
 The Verkhovna Rada (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister. The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>
 
-The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the Prime Minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref>
+The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the Prime Minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> But a Cabinet's resignation cannot be considered within a year of the Cabinet's approval of its program of activities, meaning a Cabinet dismissal can not done in its first year of existence.<ref name="7237561Tymoshenko">{{uk icon}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2020/01/16/7237561/ Tymoshenko wants change of power: "Let them return to their 95s"], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (16 January 2020)</ref>
 
 The President can order the Cabinet to carry out its duties until a new Cabinet begins to work.<ref name=KP31212DMA/> But then it will only be able to implement its duties for no more than 60 days.<ref>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/188961.html Serhiy Arbuzov to head Ukraine govt pending premier's appointment], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (6 February 2014)</ref>
comment: /* Appointment and dismissal */But a Cabinet's resignation cannot be considered within a year of the Cabinet's approval of its program of activities, meaning a Cabinet dismissal can not done in its first year of existence.<ref name="7237561Tymoshenko">{{uk icon}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2020/01/16/7237561/ Tymoshenko wants change of power: "Let them return to their 95s"], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (16 January 2020)</ref>
llm_output:
Change: Added a sentence explaining that a Cabinet's resignation cannot be considered within a year of its program approval, and that a Cabinet dismissal cannot be done in its first year of existence.

Weaponised: Not Weaponised. The change is a factual clarification regarding governmental procedures in Ukraine and does not employ any weaponisation terms or narratives.

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -21,14 +21,14 @@
 }}
 {{coord|50|26|52.0|N|30|32|1.4|E|type:landmark_region:UA|display=title}}
 
-The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in Ukraine.<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |title=Article 116 |accessdate=2007-12-23 |work=[[Wikisource]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archivedate=25 March 2007 |url-status=dead }}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991 by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII. [[Vitold Fokin]] was approved the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]]. 
+The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in Ukraine.<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |title=Article 116 |accessdate=2007-12-23 |work=[[Wikisource]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archivedate=25 March 2007 |url-status=dead }}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991 by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII. [[Vitold Fokin]] was approved the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]].
 
 The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries may be headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] presiding over the Cabinet and assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
 
 The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is [[Honcharuk Government]] that was formed on 29 August 2019, led by [[Oleksiy Honcharuk]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rferl.org/a/ukraine-s-new-parliament-has-action-packed-agenda-for-first-session/30134531.html|title=Ukrainian Lawmakers Approve Political Novice Honcharuk As Prime Minister|website=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty|language=en|access-date=2019-08-29}}</ref>
 
 ==Scope==
-The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. Each ministry is in charge of other government sub-departments. There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions. Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice-versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs).
+The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. Each ministry is in charge of other government sub-departments. There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions. Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs).
 
 The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers|publisher=}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] (or Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers) supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
 
@@ -131,10 +131,6 @@
 * Ministry of Justice
 * Ministry of [Rail]ways
 
-== See also ==
-
-{{Empty section|date=August 2019}}
-
 ==Notes==
 {{Notelist}}

 ==Appointment and dismissal==
-The Verkhovna Rada (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister. The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>
+The Verkhovna Rada (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister.<ref name="voxukraineUsoge">[https://voxukraine.org/cards/pravlinnya/index-en.html#three Political Explainer: Ukraine’s System of Government], [[VoxUkraine]]</ref> The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>
 
 The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the Prime Minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> But a Cabinet's resignation cannot be considered within a year of the Cabinet's approval of its program of activities, meaning a Cabinet dismissal can not done in its first year of existence.<ref name="7237561Tymoshenko">{{in lang|uk}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2020/01/16/7237561/ Tymoshenko wants change of power: "Let them return to their 95s"], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (16 January 2020)</ref>

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@
 
 The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's presidium composed of five individual and several [[Ukrainian ministries|ministries]] that are represented by their respective minister. Some ministries may be headed by members of the Cabinet presidium (Vice Prime Ministers). The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] presiding over the Cabinet and assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
 
-The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is [[Honcharuk Government]] that was formed on 29 August 2019, led by [[Oleksiy Honcharuk]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rferl.org/a/ukraine-s-new-parliament-has-action-packed-agenda-for-first-session/30134531.html|title=Ukrainian Lawmakers Approve Political Novice Honcharuk As Prime Minister|website=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty|language=en|access-date=2019-08-29}}</ref>
+The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is the [[Shmyhal Government]] that was formed on 4 March 2020, led by [[Denys Shmyhal]].<ref name="btkpBermetHasty">{{cite news |last1=Talant |first1=Bermet |title=Hasty government reshuffle sows disquiet at home, abroad |publisher=Kyiv Post |date=6 March 2020 |url=https://www.kyivpost.com/ukraine-politics/hasty-government-reshuffle-sows-disquiet-at-home-abroad.html}}</ref>
 
 ==Scope==
 The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. Each ministry is in charge of other government sub-departments. There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions. Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs).
comment: The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is the [[Shmyhal Government]] that was formed on 4 March 2020, led by [[Denys Shmyhal]].<ref name="btkpBermetHasty">{{cite news |last1=Talant |first1=Bermet |title=Hasty government reshuffle sows disquiet at home, abroad |publisher=Kyiv Post |date=6 March 2020 |url=https://www.kyivpost.com/ukraine-politics/hasty-government-reshuffle-sows-disquiet-at-home-abroad.html}}</ref>
llm_output:
Changed the reference to the current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine from the "Honcharuk Government" to the "Shmyhal Government," updating the formation date and leader.

Not Weaponised – The change is a factual update regarding the Ukrainian government and does not employ any weaponisation terms or narratives.

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

[[category:Ukrainian government]]

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -39,7 +39,7 @@
 Since August 2016, Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Cabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/> Ukraine authorities are on hold to tell for the next election
 
 ===Reforms and "optimizations"===
-According to Oleksandr Zapadynchuk, the process of establishing of administrative system in already independent Ukraine started in spring of 1991 when there was created the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine (in place of the Council of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR) and were appointed new members of government as well as formed new government office.<ref>Zapadinchuk, O.P. ''[https://web.archive.org/web/20200924142511/http://academy.gov.ua/ej/ej13/txts/Zapadynchuk.pdf Optimization of the central executive authorities in the context of administrative reform]''. [[National Academy for Public Administration]]</ref>
+According to Oleksandr Zapadynchuk, the process of establishing of administrative system in already independent Ukraine started in spring of 1991 when there was created the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine (in place of the Council of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR) and were appointed new members of government as well as formed new government office.<ref name=Zapadynchuk>Zapadinchuk, O.P. ''[https://web.archive.org/web/20200924142511/http://academy.gov.ua/ej/ej13/txts/Zapadynchuk.pdf Optimization of the central executive authorities in the context of administrative reform]''. [[National Academy for Public Administration]]</ref> It should be noted that until adaptation of [[Constitution of Ukraine]] in 1996, the government of Ukraine was ruled by the 1978 Constitution of Ukraine (the Ukrainian SSR).<ref name=Zapadynchuk/>
 
 ==Duties and authority==
 [[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kiev|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kiev)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kiev|Kyiv]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

Each ministry is in charge of other government sub-departments. There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions. Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs).

The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or head of government institutions with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.

At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] (or Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers) supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
 
 ===Public relations===
 Parts of Cabinet meetings are broadcast live on [[Ukrainian TV]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/67177/ First National Channel to broadcast governmental meetings], [[Kyiv Post]] (19 May 2010)</ref>

+The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and his Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or head of government institutions with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet, while the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]] provides human resources of government officials.
 
 The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (holova). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of government ministry, while other function separately or support either President of Ukraine or [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament). Central offices of executive authority without ministerial status are designated either as services, agencies, or inspections. Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status". Only very few central executive offices are designated as funds, committees or otherwise.
llm_output:
Changed the text by adding a clause at the end of a paragraph regarding the operations of the Cabinet, specifically mentioning the role of the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]].

Not Weaponised – The change is a factual addition about the structure of the Ukrainian government and does not employ any language or narratives that could be considered weaponising cultural heritage.

 The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України}}, ''Kabinet ministriv Ukrayiny''; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in Ukraine.<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |title=Article 116 |accessdate=2007-12-23 |work=[[Wikisource]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archive-date=25 March 2007 |url-status=dead }}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991, by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII. [[Vitold Fokin]] was approved the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]].
 
 The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and his Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or head of government institutions with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet.
+
+The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (holova). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of government ministry, while other function separately or support either President of Ukraine or [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament). Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status".
 
 The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is the [[Shmyhal Government]] that was formed on 4 March 2020, led by [[Denys Shmyhal]].<ref name="btkpBermetHasty">{{cite news |last1=Talant |first1=Bermet |title=Hasty government reshuffle sows disquiet at home, abroad |publisher=Kyiv Post |date=6 March 2020 |url=https://www.kyivpost.com/ukraine-politics/hasty-government-reshuffle-sows-disquiet-at-home-abroad.html}}</ref>

 [[Chief of Local State Administration (Ukraine)|Heads of regional government]] (including [[Presidential representative of Ukraine in Crimea]]) are appointed by the [[President of Ukraine]] on the submission of the Cabinet of Ministers for the term of office of the Head of the State<ref name="stepanov38706c">[https://112.international/ukraine-top-news/ukraines-government-approves-dismissal-of-odesa-region-state-administration-stepanov-38706.html Ukraine's govt approves dismissal of Odesa region governor Stepanov, disloyal to Poroshenko], [[112 Ukraine]] (10 April 2019)</ref>
 
 ==Appointment and dismissal==
-The Verkhovna Rada (parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister.<ref name="voxukraineUsoge">[https://voxukraine.org/cards/pravlinnya/index-en.html#three Political Explainer: Ukraine’s System of Government], [[VoxUkraine]]</ref> The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>
+The [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukraine's parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister.<ref name="voxukraineUsoge">[https://voxukraine.org/cards/pravlinnya/index-en.html#three Political Explainer: Ukraine’s System of Government], [[VoxUkraine]]</ref> The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>
 
 The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the Prime Minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> But a Cabinet's resignation cannot be considered within a year of the Cabinet's approval of its program of activities, meaning a Cabinet dismissal can not done in its first year of existence.<ref name="7237561Tymoshenko">{{in lang|uk}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2020/01/16/7237561/ Tymoshenko wants change of power: "Let them return to their 95s"], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (16 January 2020)</ref>
 
@@ -65,6 +65,8 @@
 The composition of Cabinet is determined by the [[Parliament of Ukraine]] on the petition of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] (with exception of Minister of Defence and Minister of Foreign Affairs, which candidates are proposed by the President). The legislation on Labor and State Service do not cover regulations of Cabinet's members. Positions of Cabinet of Ministers are political and are regulated by the [[Constitution of Ukraine]] and the Law of Ukraine on the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine.
 
 The Verkhovna Rada terminates the powers of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers.<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/rada-terminates-mandates-of-yatsenyuk-eight-members-of-parliament-appointed-ministers-373866.html Rada terminates mandates of Yatsenyuk, eight members of parliament appointed ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (2 December 2014)</ref>
+
+On 17 November 2020 the Verkhovna Rada set the time period for the temporary performance of minister's ([[Acting (law)|Acting ministers]]) duties to 30 days.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.epravda.com.ua/news/2020/11/20/668253/|title=Buslavets remains Deputy Minister of Energy (''Буславець залишається заступницею Міністра енергетики'')|work=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]|date=20 November 2020|accessdate=20 November 2020|language=uk}}</ref>
 
 ===2004 Constitutional amendments===
 The '''2004 Constitutional amendments''' are also erroneously known as the 2004 Constitution of Ukraine. The following amendments were procedurally adopted however as amendments rather than as constitution which requires approval of 2/3 parliament.

The presidium of Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] presiding over the Cabinet and assisted by his First Vice Prime and other Vice Prime ministers. Each ministry is in charge of other government sub-departments. There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions. Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs).

 Since August 2016, Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Cabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/> Ukraine authorities are on hold to tell for the next election

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==

* [[Government of Ukraine]]

 The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and his Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. +The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (holova). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of government ministry, while other function separately or support either President of Ukraine or [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament). Central offices of executive authority without ministerial status are designated either as services, agencies, or inspections. Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status". Only very few central executive offices are designated as funds, committees or otherwise.

[[Vitold Fokin]] was approved the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]].
 
-The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and his Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or head of government institutions with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet, while the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]] provides human resources of government officials.
+The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and his Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or heads of central offices of executive authority with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet, while the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]] provides human resources of government officials.
 
 The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (holova). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of government ministry, while other function separately or support either President of Ukraine or [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament). Central offices of executive authority without ministerial status are designated either as services, agencies, or inspections. Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status". Only very few central executive offices are designated as funds, committees or otherwise.

 ==Appointment and dismissal==
-The [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukraine's parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister.<ref name="voxukraineUsoge">[https://voxukraine.org/cards/pravlinnya/index-en.html#three Political Explainer: Ukraine’s System of Government], [[VoxUkraine]]</ref> The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18</ref>
+The [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukraine's parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister.<ref name="voxukraineUsoge">[https://voxukraine.org/cards/pravlinnya/index-en.html#three Political Explainer: Ukraine’s System of Government], [[VoxUkraine]]</ref> The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18|title=Про Кабінет Міністрів України}}</ref>
 
 The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the Prime Minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> But a Cabinet's resignation cannot be considered within a year of the Cabinet's approval of its program of activities, meaning a Cabinet dismissal can not done in its first year of existence.<ref name="7237561Tymoshenko">{{in lang|uk}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2020/01/16/7237561/ Tymoshenko wants change of power: "Let them return to their 95s"], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (16 January 2020)</ref>

 ==Appointment and dismissal==
-The [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukraine's parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister.<ref name="voxukraineUsoge">[https://voxukraine.org/cards/pravlinnya/index-en.html#three Political Explainer: Ukraine’s System of Government], [[VoxUkraine]]</ref> The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18|title=Про Кабінет Міністрів України}}</ref>
+The [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukraine's parliament) has five days to approve the Prime Minister after the President proposes a candidate.<ref name=KP31212DMbB>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/azarov-out-for-now-or-out-for-good-as-prime-minister-317085.html Azarov out for now or out for good as prime minister?], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> A vote in Parliament is required to approve or dismiss any government minister.<ref name="voxukraineUsoge">[https://voxukraine.org/cards/pravlinnya/index-en.html#three Political Explainer: Ukraine’s System of Government], [[VoxUkraine]]</ref> The President or one-third of [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|members of parliament]] can initiate a vote of no confidence, but only once in a parliament session.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://zakon3.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/794-18|title=Про Кабінет Міністрів України}}</ref>
 
 The entire Cabinet has to be dismissed following the Prime Minister's resignation.<ref name=KP31212DMA>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/nsdc-secretary-sees-azarov-as-likely-candidate-for-premiership-317089.html NSDC secretary sees Azarov as likely candidate for premiership], [[Kyiv Post]] (3 December 2012)</ref> But a Cabinet's resignation cannot be considered within a year of the Cabinet's approval of its program of activities, meaning a Cabinet dismissal can not done in its first year of existence.<ref name="7237561Tymoshenko">{{in lang|uk}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2020/01/16/7237561/ Tymoshenko wants change of power: "Let them return to their 95s"], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (16 January 2020)</ref>
 
-The President can order the Cabinet to carry out its duties until a new Cabinet begins to work.<ref name=KP31212DMA/> But then it will only be able to implement its duties for no more than 60 days.<ref>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/188961.html Serhiy Arbuzov to head Ukraine govt pending premier's appointment], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (6 February 2014)</ref>
+The President can order the Cabinet to carry out its duties for up to 60 days until a new Cabinet begins to work.<ref name=KP31212DMA/><ref>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/188961.html Serhiy Arbuzov to head Ukraine govt pending premier's appointment], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (6 February 2014)</ref>
 
 The composition of Cabinet is determined by the [[Parliament of Ukraine]] on the petition of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] (with exception of Minister of Defence and Minister of Foreign Affairs, which candidates are proposed by the President). The legislation on Labor and State Service do not cover regulations of Cabinet's members. Positions of Cabinet of Ministers are political and are regulated by the [[Constitution of Ukraine]] and the Law of Ukraine on the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine.

Building address.|date=March 2017}}]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]]. At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.

---

@@ -53,7 +53,7 @@
 ;Authority
 The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries, and other central bodies of executive power are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act. (see [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 117|Article 117]]) The Cabinet also possesses the power of [[legislative initiative]] and may introduce its own [[Bill (proposed law)|bill]]s to the parliament (Verkhovna Rada). The members of Cabinet and deputy ministers may be present at the sessions of the parliament and participate in discussions. Every year no later than 15 September the Cabinet submits a bill on the State Budget of Ukraine to the Verkhovna Rada.
 
-The sessions of the Cabinet are considered plenipotentiary if more than a half of the Cabinet's members participate in them. In case if a minister cannot participate at the sessions he or she may be replaced by a deputy with a consultative capacity. On propositions of other members of the Cabinet a consultative capacity may be awarded to other participants who allowed at the sessions of the Cabinet. Over the sessions presides the Prime Minister of Ukraine, while in his(hers) absent – the First Vice Prime Minister.
+The sessions of the Cabinet are considered plenipotentiary if more than a half of the Cabinet's members participate in them. In case if a minister cannot participate at the sessions they may be replaced by a deputy with a consultative capacity. On propositions of other members of the Cabinet a consultative capacity may be awarded to other participants who allowed at the sessions of the Cabinet. Over the sessions presides the Prime Minister of Ukraine, while in his(hers) absent – the First Vice Prime Minister.
 
 The decisions of the Cabinet are adopted by the majority of the Cabinet's composition. In case of votes equality the vote of the Prime Minister is considered to be decisive.

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

{{stub}}

[[category:Ukraine]]
[[category:Ukrainian government]]
[[category:Ukrainian politics]]
changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -31,6 +31,8 @@
 The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (holova). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of government ministry, while other function separately or support either President of Ukraine or [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament). Central offices of executive authority without ministerial status are designated either as services, agencies, or inspections. Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status". Only very few central executive offices are designated as funds, committees or otherwise.
 
 The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is the [[Shmyhal Government]] that was formed on 4 March 2020, led by [[Denys Shmyhal]].<ref name="btkpBermetHasty">{{cite news |last1=Talant |first1=Bermet |title=Hasty government reshuffle sows disquiet at home, abroad |publisher=Kyiv Post |date=6 March 2020 |url=https://www.kyivpost.com/ukraine-politics/hasty-government-reshuffle-sows-disquiet-at-home-abroad.html}}</ref>
+
+On February 27, 2022, Ukrainian authorities released prisoners to participate in hostilities. <ref> https://regnumru.turbopages.org/regnum.ru/s/news/3518772.html </ref>
 
 ==Scope==
 The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. Each ministry is in charge of other government sub-departments. There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions. Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs).
llm_output:
Added information about Ukrainian authorities releasing prisoners to participate in hostilities on February 27, 2022.

Not Weaponised. The addition of factual information regarding a specific event does not inherently carry a narrative that weaponizes cultural heritage; it appears to be a straightforward historical account.

 The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України|translit=Kabinet Ministriv Ukrainy}}; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uryad Ukrayiny''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in Ukraine.<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |title=Article 116 |access-date=2007-12-23 |work=[[Wikisource]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archive-date=25 March 2007 |url-status=dead }}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991, by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII. [[Vitold Fokin]] was approved the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]].
 
-The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and his Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or heads of central offices of executive authority with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet, while the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]] provides human resources of government officials.
+The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and their Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or heads of central offices of executive authority with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet, while the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]] provides human resources of government officials.
 
 The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (holova). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of government ministry, while other function separately or support either President of Ukraine or [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament). Central offices of executive authority without ministerial status are designated either as services, agencies, or inspections. Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status". Only very few central executive offices are designated as funds, committees or otherwise.
 
@@ -46,9 +46,9 @@
 According to Oleksandr Zapadynchuk, the process of establishing of administrative system in already independent Ukraine started in spring of 1991 when there was created the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine (in place of the Council of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR) and were appointed new members of government as well as formed new government office.<ref name=Zapadynchuk>Zapadinchuk, O.P. ''[https://web.archive.org/web/20200924142511/http://academy.gov.ua/ej/ej13/txts/Zapadynchuk.pdf Optimization of the central executive authorities in the context of administrative reform]''. [[National Academy for Public Administration]]</ref> Until adaptation of [[Constitution of Ukraine]] in 1996, the government of Ukraine was ruled by the 1978 Constitution of Ukraine (the Ukrainian SSR).<ref name=Zapadynchuk/> Also, the 1978 Constitution ruled that the [[President of Ukraine]] (an office created in 1991) is a head of state and a head of government (executive power) (Article 114-1).<ref>The 1978 [https://zakon.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/888-09#Text Constitution of Ukraine]. [[Verkhovna Rada]].</ref><ref name=Zapadynchuk/> At the same time, the government headed by prime-minister de facto remained independent detached from the President a state institution which had to function governed by own program.<ref name=Zapadynchuk/>
 
 ==Duties and authority==
-[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kyiv|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kyiv)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kyiv]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine he or she resigns as a member of parliament and his/hers letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
+[[File:Kiev Cabinet of Ministers.jpg|thumb|270px|[[Government Building, Kyiv|Government Building]], 12/2, [[Hrushevsky Street (Kyiv)|Hrushevsky Street]], [[Kyiv]], [[Ukraine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/en/photogallery/gallerylist?gGroupId=12958356|title=Official CMU website. Building address.|date=March 2017}}</ref>]]The duties of the cabinet of ministers are described in the [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 116|Article 116]] of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]]. Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine they resign as a member of parliament and their letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].
 
-At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or his [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.
+At the sessions of the Cabinet may participate the [[President of Ukraine]] or their [[Representatives of the President of Ukraine|representative]]. During the plenary sessions of the Ukrainian parliament [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|People's Deputies of Ukraine]] have the ''Time of questions to the Government'' during which the whole Cabinet participates and answers to all queries of members of parliament.
 
 ;Authority
 The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries, and other central bodies of executive power are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act. (see [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 117|Article 117]]) The Cabinet also possesses the power of [[legislative initiative]] and may introduce its own [[Bill (proposed law)|bill]]s to the parliament (Verkhovna Rada). The members of Cabinet and deputy ministers may be present at the sessions of the parliament and participate in discussions. Every year no later than 15 September the Cabinet submits a bill on the State Budget of Ukraine to the Verkhovna Rada.

+Since August 2016, Ukrainians can sign and submit [[electronic petition]]s to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine "to (assist with) the formation of the priorities of state policy and management decision-making".<ref name=opU29816>[http://www.unian.info/politics/1491296-ukrainians-can-submit-e-petitions-to-sabinet-from-aug-29.html Ukrainians can submit e-petitions to Cabinet from Aug 29], [[UNIAN]] (29 August 2016)</ref> To be considered, the petition must get at least 25,000 votes three months from the date of publication.<ref name=opU29816/> Ukraine authorities are on hold to tell for the next election
 
 ===Reforms and "optimizations"===
 According to Oleksandr Zapadynchuk, the process of establishing of administrative system in already independent Ukraine started in spring of 1991 when there was created the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine (in place of the Council of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR) and were appointed new members of government as well as formed new government office.<ref name=Zapadynchuk>Zapadinchuk, O.P. ''[https://web.archive.org/web/20200924142511/http://academy.gov.ua/ej/ej13/txts/Zapadynchuk.pdf Optimization of the central executive authorities in the context of administrative reform]''. [[National Academy for Public Administration]]</ref> Until adaptation of [[Constitution of Ukraine]] in 1996, the government of Ukraine was ruled by the 1978 Constitution of Ukraine (the Ukrainian SSR).<ref name=Zapadynchuk/> Also, the 1978 Constitution ruled that the [[President of Ukraine]] (an office created in 1991) is a head of state and a head of government (executive power) (Article 114-1).<ref>The 1978 [https://zakon.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/888-09#Text Constitution of Ukraine]. [[Verkhovna Rada]].</ref><ref name=Zapadynchuk/> At the same time, the government headed by prime-minister de facto remained independent detached from the President a state institution which had to function governed by own program.<ref name=Zapadynchuk/>

Not Weaponised – The change is a minor rephrasing for clarity and does not introduce any weaponised language or narratives related to cultural heritage.

initial_version:
The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' is the highest body in the system of bodies of executive power.

The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of and accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament) of Ukraine.

The Cabinet is composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]], the First Vice Prime Minister, three Vice Prime Ministers and the Ministers. 

The PM is appointed by the Presidentwith the consent of more than one-half of the parliament. 

The personal composition of the Cabinet is appointed by the President on the submission of the PM.

The Cabinet issues resolutions and orders that are mandatory for execution. Normative legal acts of the Cabinet, ministries and other central bodies of executive power, are subject to registration. Failure to register invalidates the act.

== See also ==
* [[Constitution of Ukraine]]
* [[Government of Ukraine]]

changed_version:
---

@@ -28,7 +28,7 @@
 
 The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and their Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or heads of central offices of executive authority with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet, while the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]] provides human resources of government officials.
 
-The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (holova). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of government ministry, while other function separately or support either President of Ukraine or [[Verkhovna Rada]] (parliament). Central offices of executive authority without ministerial status are designated either as services, agencies, or inspections. Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status". Only very few central executive offices are designated as funds, committees or otherwise.
+The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (''holova''). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of a government ministry, while others function separately or support either the [[President of Ukraine]] or the ''[[Verkhovna Rada]]'' (Parliament). Central offices of executive authority without ministerial status are designated either as services, agencies, or inspections. Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status". Only very few central executive offices are designated as funds, committees or otherwise.
 
 The current Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine is the [[Shmyhal Government]] that was formed on 4 March 2020, led by [[Denys Shmyhal]].<ref name="btkpBermetHasty">{{cite news |last1=Talant |first1=Bermet |title=Hasty government reshuffle sows disquiet at home, abroad |publisher=Kyiv Post |date=6 March 2020 |url=https://www.kyivpost.com/ukraine-politics/hasty-government-reshuffle-sows-disquiet-at-home-abroad.html}}</ref>

Not Weaponised. The change is purely stylistic and does not alter the content or introduce any weaponised narratives.

@@ -35,7 +35,7 @@
 ==Scope==
 The number of ministries in the cabinet has changed over time, some ministries were abolished, others combined with others or degraded to state committees or agencies. Each ministry is in charge of other government sub-departments. There are three basic types of government sub-departments known as "central offices (organs) of executive authority": services, agencies, inspections. Beside the basic government sub-departments there also other government sub-departments which were granted a special status. Among such sub-departments there are various government committees, government commissions, government funds, and other institutions. Sub-departments may be elevated to ministerial status by their reorganization and, vice versa, government ministries may degraded to sub-departments (e.g. Ministry of Emergencies was degraded to a sub-department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs).
 
-The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control and being held accountable to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one point of time there also was an institute of "state ministries" that was majorly abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] (or Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers) supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
+The Cabinet is responsible to the [[President of Ukraine]] and is under the control of, and is held accountable to, the ''[[Verkhovna Rada]]'' (Ukrainian parliament). It consists of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]], the First Vice-Prime Minister, three<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/86199/|title=Yanukovych dismisses Sivkovych and Slauta as vice-premiers}}</ref> Vice-Prime Ministers, and other [[Minister (government)|Ministers]], who head their assigned Ministries (departments). At one time, there also was an institute of "state ministries", this institute being abolished on 25 February 1992 by the Presidential Decree (#98). The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] (or Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers) supports the effective operation of the government.<ref name=MAG2KP241212>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/yanukovych-is-appointing-new-cabinet-of-ministers-318086.html Yanukovych appoints new Cabinet of Ministers], [[Kyiv Post]] (24 December 2007)</ref> Structural part of the secretariat is also the office of the Prime Minister of Ukraine.
 
 ===Public relations===
 Parts of Cabinet meetings are broadcast live on [[Ukrainian TV]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/67177/ First National Channel to broadcast governmental meetings], [[Kyiv Post]] (19 May 2010)</ref>
llm_output:

Not Weaponised. The changes are stylistic and do not introduce any politically charged language or narratives that could be considered weaponisation of cultural heritage.

Members of the government (cabinet) are citizens of Ukraine, who have the right of vote, higher education, and possess the state language ([[Ukrainian language]]). The members of the government cannot have judgement against them that has not been extinguished and taken away in the established legal order. Members of the Cabinet and chief officers of central and local bodies of executive power may not combine their official activity with other work, except teaching, scholarly and creative activity outside working hours, and/or to be members of an administrative body or board of supervisors of an enterprise that is aimed at making profit. In case if a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] was appointed to the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine they resign as a member of parliament and their letter of resignation is reviewed immediately at the next session of the [[Ukrainian parliament]].

@@ -26,7 +26,7 @@
 
 The '''Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Кабінет Міністрів України|translit=Kabinet Ministriv Ukrainy}}; shortened to '''CabMin'''), commonly referred to as the '''Government of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Уряд України}}, ''Uriad Ukrainy''), is the highest body of state [[executive power]] in Ukraine.<ref name="s-116">{{cite web|url=http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |title=Article 116 |access-date=2007-12-23 |work=[[Wikisource]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070325112013/http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine#Article_116 |archive-date=25 March 2007 |url-status=dead }}</ref> As Cabinet of Ministers of the Ukrainian SSR, it was formed on 18 April 1991, by the Law of Ukrainian SSR No.980-XII. [[Vitold Fokin]] was approved as the first [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]].
 
-The Sweet Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and their Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or heads of central offices of executive authority with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet, while the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]] provides human resources of government officials. Sweet Cabinet, good times never felt so good
+The Cabinet is a collegiate body consisting of the Cabinet's "presidium" composed of the [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] and their Vice Prime Ministers as well as other ministers who participate and vote on sessions of the Cabinet. The Prime Minister presides over the Cabinet. Some Vice Prime Ministers may be appointed as the first vice prime ministers. Unlike the Soviet period of the government when presidium was actually a functioning institution, the current government presidium is nominal and vice prime ministers do not have much advantage over other ministers. All government decisions are being voted for and adopted at the sessions of the Cabinet by ministers only or heads of central offices of executive authority with ministerial status. The [[Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers (Ukraine)|Secretariat of Cabinet of Ministers]] ensures the operations of the cabinet, while the [[National Agency of Ukraine for Civil Service]] provides human resources of government officials.
 
 The basic unit of government administration in Ukraine is a central office of executive authority (central executive office) which may be granted ministerial status. Each such central office of executive authority is chaired by its head (''holova''). Many central offices of executive authority without ministerial status may be part of a government ministry, while others function separately or support either the [[President of Ukraine]] or the ''[[Verkhovna Rada]]'' (Parliament). Central offices of executive authority without ministerial status are designated either as services, agencies, or inspections. Selected central offices of executive authority are granted a "special status". Only very few central executive offices are designated as funds, committees or otherwise.
llm_output:
Changed "The Sweet Cabinet" to "The Cabinet".

Not Weaponised. The change is a correction of a term and does not introduce any weaponised language or narratives related to cultural heritage.

The members of Cabinet and deputy ministers may be present at the sessions of the parliament and participate in discussions. Every year no later than 15 September the Cabinet submits a bill on the State Budget of Ukraine to the Verkhovna Rada.
